title: Why does my 0/4/0 Yasuo who has the least amount of gold in the game have a 370 gold bounty?
body:
https://i.imgur.com/oaMERqR.png)

In what world can this possibly be justified? He should be worth LESS not MORE. Riot needs to fix their new bounty system, it makes absolutely no sense. Hearing "Shut down" after the Yasuo promptly died for the fifth time was extremely tilting. By the way, I know that the Xerath support technically has 31 less gold than him but hopefully you get the point.

replies.body:
This is a given.
I think, in general, only the snowball players have any interest in this system continuing.
The game has serious issues with the game speed and lack of skill as it is and this further ruins it.

> [{quoted}](name=MrHaZeYo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=m2Ml4LU7,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-01-21T22:22:13.728+0000)
>
> Does he have 2108 CS? Wtf.

No, he has 133. The yellow numbers in the middle are the creep scores. He had 2,108 gold on him at that point, and he had 5,818 gold in total.

Is it possible that the enemy Fiora and Warwick (and to a lesser extent zed and twitch) were recently shut down? 

I'm wondering if even though he's still behind your opponents, they may have already given up larger bounties than he currently has. I.e. in round 1 they gained a large lead, in round 2 yasuo made a partial comeback (to set his own potential bounty, which didn't show because it was smaller than all other Champions) and your opponent's bounties were claimed, so that in round 3 yasuo now gets a bounty? 

I'm not claiming it's fair, but it's definitely less unfair to get a bounty on the last place player if the other players in the game that are now only marginally ahead of him have already given large bounties. In fact, in those players shoes it would feel unfair to NOT receive a bounty for killing someone that has caught up to you partially through his allies cashing in on your bounty earlier. 

Although personally, I really dislike the new bounty system as a whole. CS bounties are dumb (specifically when they further increase a bounty on kills - I admire the purpose of denying proxy singed from becoming worthless while getting lots of gold himself, but I despise the result that getting kills and earning a cs lead through Lane dominance just leads to excessively high bounties), 1000g bounties are pretty dumb (especially on non-carries). 

I've purposely walked into the enemy support at low health and traded with them to get rid of my 1000g bounty on maokai/Galio (when no objectives were available / we wouldn't lose anything on my death). There's little doubt I'll die as a front line champion in a teamfight eventually, and giving that kind of bounty to the enemy's carry who's already doing even / better than my carry is going to be disastrous.
CS bounty. The more he farms up without killing or being killed, he builds a CS bounty.

> [{quoted}](name=The entire team,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=m2Ml4LU7,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-01-21T21:29:48.225+0000)
>
> CS bounty. The more he farms up without killing or being killed, he builds a CS bounty.

I'm well aware that CS bounties exist now. What I'm saying is that Riot clearly needs to take another look at the system they use to calculate bounties, since there is absolutely no reason that the other team should be rewarded more for killing a player that is this behind.

I'm not arguing against CS bounties per se, but if it allows stuff like this to happen then something definitely needs to be fixed.

I was playing a game top lane and crushing. My team was so far behind though that my lead didnt matter... 

Still, going 6/0 gave me a nice 1000g bounty, even though my team as a whole was extremely behind...

Feelsbadman

Yeah, I'm not sure if CS bounties should accrue if you're just getting yourself back into the game, but are still as of  yet behind...  How are you supposed to not shoot yourself in the foot by trying to catch back up?
